content.question: Two carts, Cart <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> of mass <math alttext="0.25 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> and Cart <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> of mass <math alttext="0.50 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math>, are free to move along a straight, horizontal track, as shown in the figure. There is negligible friction in the axles of the carts' wheels, and Cart <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is initially moving to the right at <math alttext="4 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math> before colliding with Cart <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, which is initially at rest.
